programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After watching a film about an alien invasion, Dennis, Curly and Pie Face decide to make their own film. However, Walter stumbles across them filming, and he only sees the action, not the camera. Filming what he sees on his mobile phone, he runs to tell the whole of Beanotown about the alien invasion. As panic spreads, Dennis and his friends discover the chaos and decide to keep filming in order to help make the best of their own alien film. Meanwhile, Sergeant Slipper investigates the alien landing that Walter has seen, and discovers the truth—that the spaceship is a playhouse with glow sticks in it. Followed by 'Castle in the Air'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis and his pet dog, Gnasher, live by just one rule: Kids should make all the rules! Followed by Dance of the Seven Pies.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: To get his friends back from Walter's group, Dennis challenges Walter to a videogames battle. Followed by 'Fish Tale'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: For a school project, Dennis and Walter both build robots. However, during an accident, both robots merge, causing Dennis and Walter to defend the school. Followed by 'No Joke.'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: With one backstage pass for a Ratbucket gig, Dennis and his friends pass themselves off as Ratbucket, only for the real Ratbucket not to be able to play at his own concert. Followed by 60 second Dennis and 'Bad Dad'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After Dennis breaks his bike, Dad is unable to afford a new one, so Dennis convinces him to ask his boss for a raise. Unfortunately, Mr Scrimp reduces his wages instead. Dennis then trashes his house to convince Scrimp that his family are poor, so that Mr Scrimp will feel compelled to raise Dad's wages. Just as Scrimp has been taken in by Dennis' plan, Mum and Dad arrive home laden with shopping bags, resulting in Dad getting fired on the spot. Dennis resolves to get Dad his old job back by secretly causing chaos at his office. To restore order Scrimp rehires Dad, sealing the deal with a generous pay rise. Mum and Dad repair the house, but still don't have enough money to buy Dennis a new bike, instead it gets repaired with Dad's office rubber bands and paperclips. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Dennis Hiccups'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Believing Gnasher and Gnipper to be trapped in Beanotown Dog Pound, Dennis comes up with a plan to rescue his friends and bring them both home. Followed by more Dennis and Gnasher episodes.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: When Dennis breaks his skateboard again, Dad agrees to buy Dennis the best skateboard there is as a replacement if he is able to win a prize at the upcoming school award ceremony. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Dance of the Seven Pies'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis tries to get a birthday present by saying thank you to his relatives. However, because of Dennis' naughty personality, they take his attempts in a negative way. Followed by 'Dennis Hiccups'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: To get his friends back from Walter's group, Dennis challenges Walter to a videogames battle. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Masters of the House'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After a wrestling accident, Gnasher swallows a canister of laughing gas at the vet's. Dennis, along with Gnasher hide in the conference centre, where dad gives a speech. However, the canister leaks, causing Gnasher to fart laughing gas and having everyone laughing. Followed by 'Attack of the Walterbot'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis and Co. have to control Pie Face's obsession with pies during the Pie Festival. Otherwise, they will be grounded. Followed by 'Great Outdoors'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: On a school trip, Dennis finds out that he is descentant to a warrior tribe. He also discovers that Montanna Smith (a famous Indiana Jones-esque explorer and one of Walter's personal heroes) is actually a thief who's trying to steal the treasure of Dennis' ancestor. Will he be stopped before he gets his hands on the treasure? Followed by Dog Tired.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Mum has bought curtain material for the soon to be newly decorated kitchen, and asks Dad to look after it while she is out. However, Dad falls asleep and mistakenly agrees that Dennis can use it as a giant sail. When Dad realises that it has gone, he calls Dennis to bring it back, but unfortunately Dennis gets into a spot of bother with the colonel, who takes the curtain material off Dennis. In an attempt to steal it back, the garden being wrecked and the kitchen is left looking like a bombsite. Dennis, Gnasher and Dad have to clean up the whole kitchen and redecorate it in time for Mum returning. When Mum decides it is time to hang the new curtains, Dennis is about to get the curtain material, but Mum reveals that she has changed her mind and bought new curtains instead. Followed by 'Fangs for the Memories'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis, his friends and Walter's friends get marooned on a desert island when Dennis attempts to escape a boring field trip. Followed by Substitute Creecher

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis plays a prank on the citizens of Beanotown, causing them to evacuate, which causes trouble for Dennis later. Followed by 'No Place Like Home'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Gnasher and Gnipper enter a dog show, regardless of Walter saying they don't have true talent. He wants Athena and Miss Mini Wuff to win, but Walter has just underestimated Gnasher's true capabilities. Followed by Grounded.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Athena gets Gnasher envy when seeing a pampered version of Gnasher in a magazine and when she hears that Dennis owns an Abyssinian wire-haired tripe hound (Gnasher), she wants him. However, being an owner to Gnasher isn't all cracked up to be! Followed by 'Splash'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis gets a case of the hiccups from Mr. Har Har's can-o-giggles and is looking for a way to cure them ready for a film premier. Followed by Athena's Party

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: The garden is accidentaly wrecked when Dennis tries to give Gnasher a bath, so the gang have to fix the mess before Mum comes home. Followed by 'Run Rabbit Run'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis makes a line of practical jokes for Mr. Scrimp, called 'The Menace Collection.' However, Dennis soon learns that it will put Mr. Har Har out of business.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After Walter takes up origami as a martial art, Dennis scoffs and comes up with his own martial art, and so the two prepare to battle it out. Followed by 'Smelling of Roses'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After watching a film about an alien invasion, Dennis, Curly and Pie Face decide to make their own film. However, Walter stumbles across them filming, and he only sees the action, not the camera. Filming what he sees on his mobile phone, he runs to tell the whole of Beanotown about the alien invasion. As panic spreads, Dennis and his friends discover the chaos and decide to keep filming in order to help make the best of their own alien film. Meanwhile, Sergeant Slipper investigates the alien landing that Walter has seen, and discovers the truth—that the spaceship is a playhouse with glow sticks in it. Followed by 'Castle in the Air'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis and his pet dog, Gnasher, live by just one rule: Kids should make all the rules! Followed by Dance of the Seven Pies.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: To get his friends back from Walter's group, Dennis challenges Walter to a videogames battle. Followed by 'Fish Tale'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: For a school project, Dennis and Walter both build robots. However, during an accident, both robots merge, causing Dennis and Walter to defend the school. Followed by 'No Joke.'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: With one backstage pass for a Ratbucket gig, Dennis and his friends pass themselves off as Ratbucket, only for the real Ratbucket not to be able to play at his own concert. Followed by 60 second Dennis and 'Bad Dad'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After Dennis breaks his bike, Dad is unable to afford a new one, so Dennis convinces him to ask his boss for a raise. Unfortunately, Mr Scrimp reduces his wages instead. Dennis then trashes his house to convince Scrimp that his family are poor, so that Mr Scrimp will feel compelled to raise Dad's wages. Just as Scrimp has been taken in by Dennis' plan, Mum and Dad arrive home laden with shopping bags, resulting in Dad getting fired on the spot. Dennis resolves to get Dad his old job back by secretly causing chaos at his office. To restore order Scrimp rehires Dad, sealing the deal with a generous pay rise. Mum and Dad repair the house, but still don't have enough money to buy Dennis a new bike, instead it gets repaired with Dad's office rubber bands and paperclips. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Dennis Hiccups'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Believing Gnasher and Gnipper to be trapped in Beanotown Dog Pound, Dennis comes up with a plan to rescue his friends and bring them both home. Followed by more Dennis and Gnasher episodes.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: When Dennis breaks his skateboard again, Dad agrees to buy Dennis the best skateboard there is as a replacement if he is able to win a prize at the upcoming school award ceremony. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Dance of the Seven Pies'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis tries to get a birthday present by saying thank you to his relatives. However, because of Dennis' naughty personality, they take his attempts in a negative way. Followed by 'Dennis Hiccups'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: To get his friends back from Walter's group, Dennis challenges Walter to a videogames battle. Followed by 60 Second Dennis and 'Masters of the House'.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After a wrestling accident, Gnasher swallows a canister of laughing gas at the vet's. Dennis, along with Gnasher hide in the conference centre, where dad gives a speech. However, the canister leaks, causing Gnasher to fart laughing gas and having everyone laughing. Followed by 'Attack of the Walterbot'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis and Co. have to control Pie Face's obsession with pies during the Pie Festival. Otherwise, they will be grounded. Followed by 'Great Outdoors'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: On a school trip, Dennis finds out that he is descentant to a warrior tribe. He also discovers that Montanna Smith (a famous Indiana Jones-esque explorer and one of Walter's personal heroes) is actually a thief who's trying to steal the treasure of Dennis' ancestor. Will he be stopped before he gets his hands on the treasure? Followed by Dog Tired.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Mum has bought curtain material for the soon to be newly decorated kitchen, and asks Dad to look after it while she is out. However, Dad falls asleep and mistakenly agrees that Dennis can use it as a giant sail. When Dad realises that it has gone, he calls Dennis to bring it back, but unfortunately Dennis gets into a spot of bother with the colonel, who takes the curtain material off Dennis. In an attempt to steal it back, the garden being wrecked and the kitchen is left looking like a bombsite. Dennis, Gnasher and Dad have to clean up the whole kitchen and redecorate it in time for Mum returning. When Mum decides it is time to hang the new curtains, Dennis is about to get the curtain material, but Mum reveals that she has changed her mind and bought new curtains instead. Followed by 'Fangs for the Memories'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis, his friends and Walter's friends get marooned on a desert island when Dennis attempts to escape a boring field trip. Followed by Substitute Creecher

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis plays a prank on the citizens of Beanotown, causing them to evacuate, which causes trouble for Dennis later. Followed by 'No Place Like Home'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Gnasher and Gnipper enter a dog show, regardless of Walter saying they don't have true talent. He wants Athena and Miss Mini Wuff to win, but Walter has just underestimated Gnasher's true capabilities. Followed by Grounded.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher

However, Dad falls asleep and mistakenly agrees that Dennis can use it as a giant sail. When Dad realises that it has gone, he calls Dennis to bring it back, but unfortunately Dennis gets into a spot of bother with the colonel, who takes the curtain material off Dennis. In an attempt to steal it back, the garden being wrecked and the kitchen is left looking like a bombsite. Dennis, Gnasher and Dad have to clean up the whole kitchen and redecorate it in time for Mum returning. When Mum decides it is time to hang the new curtains, Dennis is about to get the curtain material, but Mum reveals that she has changed her mind and bought new curtains instead. Followed by 'Fangs for the Memories'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis, his friends and Walter's friends get marooned on a desert island when Dennis attempts to escape a boring field trip. Followed by Substitute Creecher

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis plays a prank on the citizens of Beanotown, causing them to evacuate, which causes trouble for Dennis later. Followed by 'No Place Like Home'

programme.desc: Gnasher and Gnipper enter a dog show, regardless of Walter saying they don't have true talent. He wants Athena and Miss Mini Wuff to win, but Walter has just underestimated Gnasher's true capabilities. Followed by Grounded.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis gets a case of the hiccups from Mr. Har Har's can-o-giggles and is looking for a way to cure them ready for a film premier. Followed by Athena's Party

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: The garden is accidentaly wrecked when Dennis tries to give Gnasher a bath, so the gang have to fix the mess before Mum comes home. Followed by 'Run Rabbit Run'

programme.desc: Dennis makes a line of practical jokes for Mr. Scrimp, called 'The Menace Collection.' However, Dennis soon learns that it will put Mr. Har Har out of business.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After Walter takes up origami as a martial art, Dennis scoffs and comes up with his own martial art, and so the two prepare to battle it out. Followed by 'Smelling of Roses'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: After watching a film about an alien invasion, Dennis, Curly and Pie Face decide to make their own film. However, Walter stumbles across them filming, and he only sees the action, not the camera. Filming what he sees on his mobile phone, he runs to tell the whole of Beanotown about the alien invasion. As panic spreads, Dennis and his friends discover the chaos and decide to keep filming in order to help make the best of their own alien film. Meanwhile, Sergeant Slipper investigates the alien landing that Walter has seen, and discovers the truth—that the spaceship is a playhouse with glow sticks in it. Followed by 'Castle in the Air'

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: Dennis and his pet dog, Gnasher, live by just one rule: Kids should make all the rules! Followed by Dance of the Seven Pies.

programme.title: Dennis and Gnasher
programme.desc: To get his friends back from Walter's group, Dennis challenges Walter to a videogames battle. Followed by 'Fish Tale'.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Golden Smurf Award: Hogatha disguises herself as the Golden Smurf Award to catch the Smurfs in order to use them as the main ingredient in her beauty cream. Vanity convinces her to try his recipe and before long, the wicked sorceress is covered with mud and sent careening over the hills into Gargamel's house.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Blue Plague: Brainy Smurf has decided to dedicate himself to the wellbeing of his fellow Smurfs. He is going to cure them of all ills… With a little help from the evil Gargamel!

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Littlest Giant: Simon is lost in the forest and in search of his parents. Simon is the son of a couple of giants. The Smurfs try to bring him home, but then Gargamel interrupts the party.

programme.title: The Horn Of Plenty
programme.desc: Mother Nature always does her best, but this time she's gone wrong. Her wand gets the wrong results and she accidentally damages the Autumn harvest. Now the Smurfs and all the forest animals face a lean and hungry winter. The only place where the Smurfs could get food would be the Land of Plenty. But Gargamel steals the famed Horn of Plenty to lure the Smurfs.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Gargamel The Generous: In an effort to find out where the Smurfs' secret diamond stash is hidden, Gargamel pretends to be their friend. When he shows his true, wicked self, Papa Smurf works a magic spell to save his little Smurfs from the vicious clutches of the evil wizard.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Unsound Smurf: In an effort to give Papa some quiet time, Brainy uses one of Papa's spells to create a magical sound barrier around the village. Papa cannot reverse the spell and sends the Smurflings, who are trapped outside the Village, to a noisemaker. Baby takes a bottle of sound from the noisemaker, which breaks the barrier.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - One Good Smurf Deserves Another: Handy Smurf has saved Clumsy from a horrible fate. Clumsy swears eternal devotion to his savior and does his best to repay his debt… With awkward results. A clever scheme is needed to stop Clumsy's well-meant catastrophes...

programme.title: Tailor's Magic Needle
programme.desc: Tailor Smurf has to make an outfit for every Smurf before the Fall fashion show. Brainy Smurf wants to help him and, using Papa Smurf's book of Magic, he conjures up a magic needle that sews ten times faster than tailor... But is it really any good?

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Last Smurfberry: Papa Smurf organizes a crew to sail to Smurfberry Island because Gargamel has killed all of the trees except one to trap the Smurfs. Gargamel follows them, but once more fails to catch them because the Witch of Smurfberry Island sends her nose-eating seagulls after them.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - A Loss Of Smurfs: When the emergency call rings, all the Smurfs in the Village drop what they are doing and run to hear the news. But when Vanity Smurf calls for an assembly so that the Smurfs can admire his new hat, it is too much. They send him on his way out of the village, and Vanity has the bad luck of meeting Lofty, the Elf, who suggests a horrible mud bath...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Little Orange Horse With Gold Shoes: Sliding down a rainbow, a little winged horse loses a golden shoe. He meets the Smurfette and she helps him look for his lost horseshoe. They fall in love somehow, for who could be unmoved by the charm of a little orange horse... Or of a Smurfette?

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Lazy's Slumber Party: Poor Lazy! All he wants is a good night's rest. But no, all the Smurfs throw a party for him and, what's more, he gets dragged into a silly argument about painting giant Bigmouth's toes a bright tangerine red... It's a long, sleepless night for poor Lazy Smurf!

programme.title: Have You Smurfed Your Pet Today?
programme.desc: The Smurfs get so involved with Handy's new toy that they forget to feed Puppy. Gargamel lures Puppy into a cage with food and holds him for ransom – the Smurfs' magic secrets. The Smurflings distract Gargamel with the toy long enough to rescue Puppy and they vow to never neglect him again.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Born Rotten: As the Smurfs prepare for the Festival of the Stars, Gargamel plants a creature in their midst that smells so rotten that he can easily be traced to the Smurf village. Papa Smurf realizes that Born Rotten is from another planet, and he instructs Feathers to return him to his home before Gargamel finds them.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - No Smurf Is An Island: Handy Smurf is the one who fixes everything that needs mending in the Village of the Smurfs. But are his efforts really appreciated by the other Smurfs? Not at all. At least this is what Handy feels when he resolves to leave the Smurfs Village forever and live in the sea with Marina the Mermaid...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Smurfs' Springtime: The wicked wizard Gargamel asks the sorcerer Balthazar for a recipe to capture the Smurfs. It involves kidnapping Mother Nature to stop the arrival of Spring. Luckily, the Smurfs save the day.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Blue Plague: Brainy Smurf has decided to dedicate himself to the wellbeing of his fellow Smurfs. He is going to cure them of all ills… With a little help from the evil Gargamel!

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - A Mere Truffle: The Smurfs love truffles but truffles belong to the Trolls and the Trolls live under Truffle Troll Mountain, where in the shadows of the lake lurks the Thing with No Name...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Most Unsmurfy Games: To prove the worth of his Big Book of Wilderness Survival, Brainy takes the Smurflings to the swamp. Where, thanks to his expert advice, the tiny group gets totally lost, is then caught in quicklime and trapped by King Bullrush of the Wartmongers. Fortunately, Bullrush is in a playful mood and devises a Smurf hunt. Unfortunately, Brainy believes he is a born leader...

programme.title: Wedding Bells For Gargamel
programme.desc: The Smurfs befriend a maiden in distress who is betrothed to Gargamel by convincing her father that the foolish wizard is insane.

programme.title: Smurf On The Run
programme.desc: Little things can sometimes bring about big effects. In trying to catch Sassette, Gargamel upsets the Balance of Truth, and from then on everybody in the world tells lies. Even Papa Smurf is changed into a pathological liar. What is more, the Spirit of the Scales chain Gargamel and Sassette to each other, and together they have to replace the Topaz of Truth....

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Magic Rattle: The Smurfs help a fairy queen outwit the evil fairy Fallon who tries to take away her son's magic rattle.

programme.title: Smurfiplication
programme.desc: The evil wizard Gargamel creates a magic formula that duplicates everything it touches. And surprise! Suddenly there are six Brainy Smurf! This creates a few interesting situations in the Village... And also at Gargamel's!

programme.title: The Great Lime Crop Failure
programme.desc: Bullrush the Wartmonger is in a panic because the lime harvest has failed. So he captures Farmer Smurf, the world's greatest agricultural expert, to solve his problems. Farmer Smurf installs an irrigation system and saves the harvest. He then escapes in a bubble and returns to the Smurfs.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Sand Witch: A swamp monster kidnaps Baby as a gift for a witch. The witch, who thinks no one loves her, is amazed when Baby shows affection. When Papa comes to rescue Baby, he makes the witch understand that the loyal swamp monster has always loved her.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurfette's Rose: Smurfette promises Mother Nature that if she creates a blue rose Smurfette will never cut it. But when the white rose becomes blue, Smurfette becomes white. The only way to make Smurfette blue again is for her to cut the rose. She reluctantly cuts the rose, returning nature to normalcy and learning that one cannot always keep a promise.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Sideshow Smurfs: Clumsy and Smurfette are captured by the wicked Bombast, who plans to exhibit them in his sideshow. Papa Smurf hurries to their rescue and using the bungling Gargamel for interference is able to rescue his Smurfs.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Prince And The Hopper: What is that strange talking frog that Morlock the Wizard sends all of Prince Theodore's soldiers to catch? Is it a demon frog, as he says, or something else? Truth will out when Smurfette and the Smurflings meet the frog. They help to change this frog back into Prince Theodore himself, for he's been the victim of a spell cast by Morlock.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Smurf A Mile In My Shoes: The Smurfs band together to retrieve a sea-shell they need to release a hermit imp from the Sea Witch, as she cursed him with ugliness and a language very few understand. The Smurfs return with the sea-shell in time to break the curse and return the hermit to the handsome imp he once was.

programme.title: The Whole Smurf And Nothing But The Smurf
programme.desc: The evil wizard Gargamel is able to capture the Smurfette. Now he is going to give her a truth serum and know all of Papa Smurf' secrets… But then Gargamel makes a big mistake and gives the Smurfette a fib formula!

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Locomotive Smurfs: Handy Smurf has hit on a revolutionary new idea: a sort of smurfless carriage that moves on railroad tracks. He calls it a railsmurfer and it makes for less work in the Village... until Gargamel chances upon it.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Unsound Smurf: In an effort to give Papa some quiet time, Brainy uses one of Papa's spells to create a magical sound barrier around the village. Papa cannot reverse the spell and sends the Smurflings, who are trapped outside the Village, to a noisemaker. Baby takes a bottle of sound from the noisemaker, which breaks the barrier.

programme.title: The Mr Smurf Contest
programme.desc: When Papa decides to throw a Harvest Moon ball, all the male Smurfs compete in a "Mr Smurf" contest for the honor of escorting Sassette. Gargamel sneaks into the contest after shrinking himself with blue dye, in the hope of capturing all the Smurfs when he returns to normal size. The Smurfs kick him out and Sassette lets Papa escort her.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Sweepy Smurf: Sweepy the chimney sweep Smurf is not the most popular inhabitant of the Village of the Smurfs. He is rather messy, and the clouds of soot that he makes certainly don't add to his popularity. Only the Smurflings find him great company as he's the only one who can get dirty and not be told off. Yet in their enthusiasm for Sweepy, the Smurflings endanger the Village.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Smurfs' Christmas: The Smurfs come to the rescue of two children and their grandfather when a mysterious stranger appears and causes their sleigh to crash. Knocking on Gargamel's door for help puts them and the Smurfs in danger…

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Baby's First Word: The Smurflings free the Smurfs from the clutches of Gargamel just in time to get Baby to its first word ceremony. Baby utters the word « Gargamel ». Papa Smurf says that this word indicates that Baby will one day become the Great Chief, as he is aware of the dangers in life.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Fountain Of Smurf: The Smurfs discover a fountain of youth that is guarded by a wicked troll, who steals Papa Smurf's magic book. They convince Gargamel to help them and the greedy villain runs to get the water, but manages to fall in with the troll. As the two chase each other all over the countryside, the Smurfs are able to retrieve Papa Smurf's book.

programme.title: Beauty Is Only Smurf Deep
programme.desc: Periwinkle, a vain Pixie, is upset when her magic mirror tells her that Vanity is the fairest, not she. Periwinkle kidnaps Vanity, but the rest of the Smurfs come to Vanity's rescue. Periwinkle sees the error of her ways and they become friends.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Born Rotten: As the Smurfs prepare for the Festival of the Stars, Gargamel plants a creature in their midst that smells so rotten that he can easily be traced to the Smurf village. Papa Smurf realizes that Born Rotten is from another planet, and he instructs Feathers to return him to his home before Gargamel finds them.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Patchwork Bear: There isn't a River Smurf anymore: someone has frozen it near its source. The Smurfs go to the Emerald Empress' country to see what the trouble is, and they meet the Patchwork Bear as well as the Iron Pyrites...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Jokey's Funny Bone: Jealous of the attention Vanity Smurf receives when he breaks his toe, Jokey Smurf feigns sickness in hopes of getting recognition. Unfortunately, his ploy turns against him and instead of loving care all he receives is the proverbial pound of curse.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Miracle Smurfer: The Smurfs learn that the mind is more powerful than matter when they are fooled by a quack's outrageously expensive miracle tonic. But Papa Smurf cures the Smurfs of their temporary naiveté and the charlatan of his villainy.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Royal Drum: No one believes Grandpa Smurf when he tells of far-away jungles and savannahs teeming with wild giant cats, striped horses, long-necked leaf-eaters and strange tribes... Only some Smurflings give some credit to his tales. But when Grandpa Smurf hears the sound of the magic Royal Drum in the forest, the one that can tame wild beasts, he sets out to prove that he's not an old addle-brained storyteller.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - A Loss Of Smurfs: When the emergency call rings, all the Smurfs in the Village drop what they are doing and run to hear the news. But when Vanity Smurf calls for an assembly so that the Smurfs can admire his new hat, it is too much. They send him on his way out of the village, and Vanity has the bad luck of meeting Lofty, the Elf, who suggests a horrible mud bath...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Baby's New Toy: Baby Smurf has lost all interest in toys. Even Jokey's surprises fail to amuse the tiny tyke. Grandpa Smurf suggests they go and pay a visit to the Toymaker, the one who makes toys for children all over the world. Or rather used to make: the Toymaker is tired of the lack of appreciation his toys receive from those who receive them.

programme.title: Brainy Smurf, Friend To All Animals
programme.desc: Brainy dons his safari hat and roams the forest to do good deeds for animals. He mostly gives advice to the creatures but balks when he can really save the life of a wildcat being hunted by Gargamel. Nat gives Brainy the courage to free the cat from Gargamel's trap.

programme.title: How To Smurf A Rainbow
programme.desc: Mother Nature is too busy to conjure a rainbow for the Smurfs' festival, so Papa Smurf borrows her cookbook and mixes up the recipe himself. As there is no yellow available, they use the leprechaun's gold to produce a beautiful rainbow before Gargamel can steal it.

programme.title: The Masked Pie-Smurfer
programme.desc: When tempers flare, the Smurfs hire a masked pie thrower to get revenge on other Smurfs. Everyone becomes even angrier as pies fly and no one knows who's doing it. When Jokey is unmasked as the culprit, Papa defends him. He says that if all the Smurfs shared their feelings, they wouldn't need a secret pie thrower.

programme.title: Skyscraper Smurfs
programme.desc: Sure, a village of mushroom-shaped houses is nice and jolly... But not very modern, in Architect Smurf's view. What the Smurfs need is smurfdominium, a new, daring concept that will change the art of living forever...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Fake Smurf: Hogatha turns herself into a Smurf, plotting revenge on the little people for destroying her magic locket. Papa Smurf outwits her and banishes her from the forest once more.

programme.title: The Smurfs And The Money Tree
programme.desc: The wicked wizard Gargamel has come up with yet another diabolical plan with the help of his mother, who isn't much nicer than him. He wants to tempt the Smurfs with money of which they have no notion. Will Greedy take the bait?

programme.title: Futuresmurfed
programme.desc: Balthazar the Enchanter is a man of vision. He knows that the times of alchemy are drawing to their end. The future belongs to those who will understand science...but how can he see into the future? Perhaps by kidnapping Father Time. The Smurfs will help to put things right after Little Thunder, a dinosaur, escapes through a gash in the fabric of time.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Adventures Of Robin Smurf: The Smurfs' theatrical production of 'Robin Smurf' comes to life as the legendary hero is portrayed by a really good actor...

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - The Golden Smurf Award: Hogatha disguises herself as the Golden Smurf Award to catch the Smurfs in order to use them as the main ingredient in her beauty cream. Vanity convinces her to try his recipe and before long, the wicked sorceress is covered with mud and sent careening over the hills into Gargamel's house.

programme.title: The Smurfs
programme.desc: The Smurfs - Greedy Goes On Strike: Get up early in the morning, before any other Smurf is out of bed, to prepare a scrumptious Smurfberry muffin. Spend all morning on preparing Smurf delicacies for lunch. Than all afternoon to have dinner ready – and delicious – on time. And do you get so much as a thank you form the Smurfs? So Greedy Smurf quits. The Village is in trouble... And soon, so is Greedy.

programme.title: Essence Of Brainy
programme.desc: Brainy Smurf is not the same anymore. He is polite, considerate, modest and calls every other Smurf Sir or Madame. All the Smurfs are worried that Brainy has lost all that makes his personality. They ought to be worried, for Brainy has been the victim of a system called an Essence Remover that Scruple, Gargamel's apprentice, uses... But Brainy's essence is coming back!
